feed.title: JHM Lab.
feed.subtitle: Optimal Transport, Topology of Singularities, Physics.

entry.title: Hamilton Weber Gibbs Liouville Measures on State Space

link.title: Hamilton Weber Gibbs Liouville Measures on State Space

entry.summary: We examine the Hamilton equations for Weber's potential in an isolated two-body system. We construct an invariant measure on the xv state space which is rather distinct from the conventional Gibbs Liouville measure.

entry.title: On Planck’s Constant h.
entry.summary: [Under Construction] We begin a review of Planck's constant $h$ in light of Weber's force law. This means re evaluating the Hamiltonian action of electrons in the hydrogen atom. This is the first of many more posts on the topic.

entry.title: Integrating Newton-Weber Equations for Two Body Electrical Systems.

link.title: Integrating Newton-Weber Equations for Two Body Electrical Systems.

entry.summary: We continue to investigate Weber's force law, especially in the two body isolated system. In this post we record the current status of our python code for integrating the Newton-Weber equations of motion. We model the orbits of the stable (-1)+(-1) molecule within the Weber critical radius.

entry.title: Coulomb vs Weber Escape Velocities and a Very Simple Graph.

link.title: Coulomb vs Weber Escape Velocities and a Very Simple Graph.

entry.summary: We continue to investigate Weber's force law in the two body isolated system. In this post we briefly remark on the difference in escape velocities as computed by Coulomb and Weber's force law.

entry.title: Book Review. The Newton Papers by Susan Dry

link.title: Book Review. The Newton Papers by Susan Dry

entry.summary: Brief book review of Susan Dry's book about Newton's Manuscripts.
